{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's reduced urine output and increased serum creatinine concentration indicate acute kidney injury (AKI). However, the patient has been receiving ketoprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID), and piperacillin/tazobactam, an antibiotic. Both of these medications can cause AKI.
